body_html: @keithshep PRs are most welcome. I would start with adding negative indexing to the current getitem/setitem (the one that currently works on the outermost dimension). This will require changes to both the kernel and the python wrappers, and updates to the shape inference code.
body_text: @keithshep PRs are most welcome.  I would start with adding negative indexing to the current getitem/setitem (the one that currently works on the outermost dimension).  This will require changes to both the kernel and the python wrappers, and updates to the shape inference code.
body: @keithshep PRs are most welcome.  I would start with adding negative indexing to the current getitem/setitem (the one that currently works on the outermost dimension).  This will require changes to both the kernel and the python wrappers, and updates to the shape inference code.
